tweets.text:
Academic equivalent of the marshmallow test

Journal A: no formatting requirements at submission, median time to review 5 months

Journal B: median time to review 5 weeks but submissions in .docx, house format only

Which do you choose?

tweets.text: Any tips on where to get protest survey data of gilet jaunes protestors would be much appreciated! https://t.co/HPzVj3RzV3
@ArunFrey Check out the works that have been done by @CEPREMAP  @ObsBienEtre @MathieuPerona

Today, we released a privacy-protective Facebook dataset with 10 Trillion cell values  https://t.co/FjEzRxwW5J Tomorrow, I'll give a webcast for TIER on differential privacy, a version of which we used with these data. Here're my slides & how to register: https://t.co/jb9xE7opKM

tweets.text: This coming Tuesday 11:00, we are welcoming Theda Skocpol in Oxford for a discussion on her iconic book, States and Social Revolution. Are its insights on conflict, revolution, and the uses of history in social science as relevant today as 40 years ago? https://t.co/lrcfGDTzCZ

I accepted an offer to join @oxfordsbs and @oxforddemsci as a Career Development Fellow in Marketing and Consumer Demography, which means Postdoc, but sounds fancier. I am really looking forward to start at @UniofOxford, but now I should really be writing this PhD. üë®‚Äçüíª#poptwitter https://t.co/1P1YP9n0kV

tweets.text:
*Flipbooks* present code step-by-step and side-by-side with output.  Now, you can build one in 5 minutes with {flipbookr}!  #rstudioconf2020 presentation, Weds 4pm

For demo:  
1. install.packages("xaringan") 
2. devtools::install_github("EvaMaeRey/flipbookr") 
3. restart RStudio https://t.co/AQgTNF1PSX

tweets.text: Week 3 (historical data) from the AER paper by Stelios Michalopoulos and @EliasPapaioann2 on the Scramble for Africa: https://t.co/HATdxOUJNm
Week 2 (event data) from Kevin Mazur's CPS paper on the Syrian Revolution: https://t.co/eq71WhIZCD
Week 1 (surveys) comes from a recent JOP paper @rorytruex and @DanielTavana on attitudes toward Sisi: https://t.co/kq5Pgxgqfx
Each week comes with its own take-home coding exercise using replication data from one of the weekly readings. I'll put all of these on my Github if anyone wants to recycle.

tweets.text: Only four weeks so have designed in a way that introduces different forms of data first, and questions in quant. research design second.

Just finished up final-ish draft of course materials for the 4-week Quantitative Research Methods module for Middle East Studies MSc. Sharing the materials here for comments and reuse! https://t.co/b9f00Iixc5

1/n Want to learn what happens when social science meets data science? @msalganik and I are pleased to announce that our *free* Summer Institutes in Computational Social Science will run in *TWENTY-ONE* locations this year! https://t.co/ZqEdYYZj4D https://t.co/KATXVtUVVP
